questions.question: Twelve inches make ………………. foot.
questions.description: The indefinite article ‘a’ can be used in the numerical sense of one.

questions.question: One evening ……………………. beggar came to my door.
questions.description: The indefinite article ‘a’ can be used in the vague sense of ‘a certain’.

questions.question: …………………….. student should obey her teacher.
questions.description: The indefinite article ‘a’ can be used in the sense of ‘any’.

questions.question: At last ……………………….. warrior in him was thoroughly aroused.
questions.description: The definite article ‘the’ is sometimes placed before a common noun to give it the meaning of an abstract noun.

questions.question: This is ………………………. best book on elementary chemistry.
questions.description: The definite article ‘the’ is used with superlative adjectives.

questions.question: What kind of ……………………….. is it?
questions.description: Articles are omitted before common nouns used in their widest sense.

questions.question: Newton was ……………………….. great scientist and philosopher.
questions.description: The indefinite article ‘a’ can be used in the numerical sense of ‘one’.

questions.question: I cannot forget ……………………….. with which he treated me.
questions.description: An abstract noun may have the article ‘the’ when it is followed by an adjective or adjectival phrase.

questions.question: ……………………… is the only animal that uses fire.
questions.description: When the noun man is used in the general sense, it does not take an article.

questions.question: ……………………. tenth chapter of this book is very interesting.
questions.description: The definite article ‘the’ is used with ordinal numbers.

questions.question: ……………………….. is its own reward.
questions.description: Articles are omitted before abstract nouns used in a general sense.

questions.question: I learnt German at ……………………..
questions.description: No article is used when the reference is to the primary purpose of the nouns school, college, hospital, prison or church.
